revised_title: The Synthesis and Properties of Rosolic Acid
tldr: The authors investigate the relationship between rosaniline and rosolic acid through a series of chemical reactions, including the action of nitrous acid on rosaniline. They find that one molecule of rosaniline consumes three equivalents of nitrous acid and produces six equivalents of nitrogen gas. The resulting non-nitrogenous substance is identified as rosolic acid, confirming its chemical and physical properties with those of previously known rosolic acid samples.
